result.execSummary:
The defendant Clay E. Thomas Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Clay E. Thomas Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Clay E. Thomas Jr. was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
No sentence credit given.
Deft accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to court every Wed at 3:30pm.

miscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  Cash bond posted, if any shall be applied.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Deft accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to court every Wed at 3:30pm.

Drug Court
Drug Court Program Participation Agreement
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge - Ct 1

Defendant Clay E Thomas appeared with Attorney Carl Johnson.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Cyndi Fowler.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:  Victim rights compliance.  Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-Fel Poss of THC-2nd, Repeater; found guilty by the court.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.  PSI report waived.  Cts 2, 3 & 4 were dismissed outright.  Defendant admits to prior convictions.
Ct 1:  Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 3 years w/conditions.  No sentence credit given.  Court costs ordered, $500 cash on deposit to be applied, remainder to be applied to def's other 3 cases, 15CF508, 15CF651 & 16CM705.  No restitution requested.  Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant.  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  Def. accepted into the Drug Court Program and to report to court every Wed. at 3:30pm.
Plea and Sentencing hrg set for 5/25/16 at 3:30pm before Br 4 Drug Court.  The 5/16/16 STC hrg w/Br 6 is canceled.

With Atty Johnson, ADA McNeill and by agreement of Judge Wagner the JS of 4/25/16 at 8:30am is removed from the calendar and a STC is set for 5/16/16 at 8:45am to see if deft is accepted into the drug court.
